page.title: 06Transport in West Enfield
page.content: The main ways of travelling are by tube train,bus,taxi and private car. The one tube station in our area is Oakwood on the Piccadilly line which goes to the centre of London.All bus services are local.Oakwood grew up around Enfield West tube station which is now called Oakwood.It is still an important station but most people who live in our area prefer to travel by car.The average journey to work is 8-10 miles and is usually to London. The majority of people in Oakwood own at least one if not two cars. People state the reasons for choosing a particular form of travel as cost,speed and convenience.At work people park in the street or firm's carpark whilst at home they park in their garage or drive.Although many people use public transport everyday most use it very rarely.
